author: Melanie Evans
title: Taxing This High Earner but Not That One: Hospital Nonprofits Wrestle With New Rules
text:
Phoenix-based hospital system Banner Health employed 11 people who earned over $1 million in 2015â€”the kind of high nonprofit pay Congress targeted in the sweeping tax overhaul enacted in December.
But a quirk of the law means Banner likely will owe tax on just five of these executives, while other large nonprofits, such as Michigan-based Trinity Health, could be taxed on more such employees.
